synopsis: In episode #9, hosts Devam and Ahir welcome guest Vivek Menon, who shares his journey as a filmmaker and discusses the creative process behind his project 'New Normal.' The conversation delves into the challenges of identity, the importance of community in filmmaking, and the joy of embracing the creative journey, all while maintaining a light-hearted and humorous tone.
quotes: The best way of learning is by doing it and putting yourself out there.
If you spend so much time and effort making something, you can't even watch it with people who are supporting youâ€”that's ridiculous.
Your experience and your voice are the most unique things you can write.
It's not about the amount of views; it's about the impact you can make.
Why can't I just call myself a filmmaker? I am one.
If you're making a podcast and it's just maybe cringy, but you're putting yourself out there, that's much more than a lot of people do.
You have to trust that if you find something interesting, others will too.
Being a successful filmmaker doesn't mean you have to be famous; it means continuously doing what you love.
Your journey is unique, and reflecting on it helps you see your growth.
The idea of success is subjective; redefine it for yourself.
